title: Test
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has increased over the Year

GDP growth compared to previous year is rapidly increasing from 2014 to 2015, roughly constant from 2015 to 2016, rapidly decreasing from 2016 to 2017, roughly constant from 2017 to 2018, slightly decreasing from 2018 to 2019, rapidly increasing from 2019 to 2020, and lastly roughly constant from 2020 to 2024.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2014 and 2015.
Max GDP growth compared to previous year about 3.55 was recorded at Year 2015
Min GDP growth compared to previous year about 0.51 was recorded at Year 2014
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2017.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2019 to 2021.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2023 to 2024.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2022 to 2023.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2021 to 2022.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2018 to 2019.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2017 to 2018.
